description:
Mycobacterium sp. VKM Ac-1817D is a species of bacteria belonging to the genus Mycobacterium. Mycobacterium is a genus of Gram-positive, aerobic, and non-spore-forming bacteria that are known for their unique cell wall structure, which is rich in lipids and mycolic acids.

The specific strain VKM Ac-1817D was isolated from an environmental sample, likely from soil or water. The strain has been designated by the All-Russian Collection of Microorganisms (VKM), which is a major microbial culture collection in Russia.

As a member of the Mycobacterium genus, Mycobacterium sp. VKM Ac-1817D is likely to possess some of the characteristic features of mycobacteria, such as the ability to form biofilms, the presence of a waxy cell wall, and potential pathogenicity in certain contexts. However, without further detailed information or research on this specific strain, it is difficult to provide a more comprehensive scientific description of its morphological, physiological, or genetic properties.
